title: Restore age-group selection UI, pastel theme + animated mascot, and sticker-board rewards

requirements.text: Restore the Age Groups section so children can always access and use age-group selection (5–6, 7–8, 9–10). Ensure the Home flow and any guards reliably route users to the Age Select screen when no age group is selected, and that the Age Select screen renders the full set of age-group cards.

quotes: My age groups section has gone

acceptanceCriteria: When no age group is selected, the app provides a clear way to reach age-group selection and successfully navigates to /age-select.
/age-select renders all configured age-group options as selectable cards and selecting one navigates to /activity-select.
Age-group selection persists across page reloads (existing localStorage-based behavior remains working).

requirements.text: Re-apply the intended kid-friendly pastel styling across the app and remove the unintended ‘bold’ look regression. Keep text high-contrast/legible, but ensure the overall look is soft pastel rather than harsh/bold, matching the existing theme tokens and design direction.

quotes: has gone back to bold instead off the pastel colour

acceptanceCriteria: Core screens (Home, Age Select, Activity Select, Play, Round Summary, Progress) use the pastel theme colors from the global theme tokens (background/primary/secondary/accent/etc.).
Default paragraph/body text is not rendered as overly bold; bold is reserved for intentional emphasis (e.g., key numbers like score/stars).
No visual regressions in readability: text remains dark/high-contrast against the pastel backgrounds.

requirements.text: Restore the animated picture/mascot experience on key screens by ensuring the mascot renders and its animations work (idle float, cheer bounce-in, encourage wiggle) wherever it is already used.
acceptanceCriteria: Mascot images referenced by the Mascot component load correctly from static assets and display on Home, Age Select, Progress, and Round Summary pages.
Mascot animation classes used by the Mascot component produce visible animation (float/cheer/wiggle) in the UI.
If an expected mascot image asset is missing, the UI fails gracefully (e.g., shows an accessible placeholder) rather than appearing blank.

requirements.text: Restore/ensure the sticker rewards system and add a sticker-board style view so that completing a level awards a sticker and the child can view earned stickers on a dedicated sticker board (a chart/board presentation, not just a plain list). Define level completion as reaching the Round Summary screen (existing behavior), and keep rewards persisted between sessions for anonymous users.

quotes: I still want the stickers and sticker board for the stickers  as a reward for completing the level

acceptanceCriteria: Completing an operations round and reaching the Round Summary screen awards exactly one sticker for that completion and shows the earned sticker on the Round Summary screen.
The Progress area includes a sticker-board UI that displays earned stickers placed into board slots in earned order (with empty slots visible when not yet earned).
Sticker rewards persist across reloads for anonymous users via localStorage (no loss of previously earned stickers).
If a sticker image fails to load, the sticker-board view shows a fallback (e.g., the sticker emoji) instead of a broken image icon.

requirements.text: Create and apply a single, consistent visual theme pass for the restored screens (Age Select, Home, Round Summary rewards moment, Progress sticker board) so the app feels cohesive and kid-friendly (soft pastels, rounded shapes, playful typography), and enforce it consistently.

quotes: has gone back to bold instead off the pastel colour

acceptanceCriteria: The same design language (colors, rounded corners, shadows, spacing) is consistently applied across the key screens.
No screen appears to use a mismatched/unstyled fallback look compared to the rest of the app.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/immutablePaths (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/components/ui).
Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not route generated images through the backend; static assets must be served from frontend/public/assets/generated.
nonGoals: Adding new game types or changing question-generation logic.
Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).

required: Sticker board background illustration, bright pastel, kid-friendly, with empty sticker slots (sticker-board-bg.dim_1200x800.png)
